text: Peddabrahmadevam is an Indian railway station in Peddabrahmadevam, a village in East Godavari district of Andhra Pradesh. It lies on the Visakhapatnam- Vijayawada section and is administered under Vijayawada railway division of South Central Railway zone. Six trains halt in this station every day. ==History== Between 1893 and 1896, of the East Coast State Railway, between Vijayawada and Cuttack was opened for traffic. The southern part of the East Coast State Railway (from Waltair to Vijayawada) was taken over by Madras Railway in 1901. == References == == External links == * Category:Railway stations in East Godavari district Category:Vijayawada railway division
title: Peddabrahmadevam railway station
